critique: This executive order establishes an Operations Coordinating Board to integrate national security policies. It involves multiple agencies and aims for coordinated execution of national security objectives. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or economic regulation. It seems to expand executive power by creating a new board and assigning it advisory functions. It centralizes authority at the federal level. It leans towards national security focus. There's no clear indication of social inclusion or exclusion.
